Compute the L Matrix for a Set of Datasets

Source: R/01_likelihood.R
fash_L_compute.Rd

Computes the L matrix, where each row corresponds to a dataset and each column corresponds to a grid value of PSD (Predictive Standard Deviation). Handles both Gaussian and Poisson likelihoods using helper functions.

fash_L_compute(
  fash_data,
  likelihood = "gaussian",
  num_cores = 1,
  grid = seq(0, 2, length.out = 10),
  pred_step = 1,
  num_basis = 30,
  betaprec = 1e-06,
  order = 2,
  verbose = FALSE
)

Arguments

fash_data

The output from fash_set_data, containing preprocessed datasets.

likelihood

A character string specifying the likelihood function to use. Options are `gaussian` and `poisson`.

num_cores

An integer specifying the number of cores to use for parallel processing.

grid

A numeric vector representing the grid of PSD (Predictive Standard Deviation) values.

pred_step

A numeric value specifying the prediction step size.

num_basis

An integer specifying the number of O-Spline basis functions to use for the approximation.

betaprec

A numeric value representing the precision of the fixed effects coefficients.

order

An integer specifying the order of the Integrated Wiener Process (IWP) prior.

verbose

A logical value. If TRUE, shows a progress bar when num_cores = 1.

Value

A numeric matrix where each row corresponds to a dataset and each column corresponds to a grid value of PSD.

Examples

# Example usage
set.seed(1)
Y <- matrix(rpois(20, lambda = 5), nrow = 4, ncol = 5)
S <- matrix(1, nrow = 4, ncol = 5)
smooth_var <- matrix(runif(20), nrow = 4, ncol = 5)
offset <- 1
fash_data_poisson <- fash_set_data(Y = Y, smooth_var = smooth_var, offset = offset)
fash_data_gaussian <- fash_set_data(Y = Y, smooth_var = smooth_var, S = S)
grid <- seq(0.1, 2, length.out = 10)
L_matrix_gaussian <-
  fashr:::fash_L_compute(fash_data_gaussian, likelihood = "gaussian",
                         num_cores = 1, grid = grid, num_basis = 30,
                         betaprec = 1e-6, order = 2, verbose = TRUE)
#> 
  |                                                                            
  |                                                                      |   0%
  |                                                                            
  |==================                                                    |  25%
  |                                                                            
  |===================================                                   |  50%
  |                                                                            
  |====================================================                  |  75%
  |                                                                            
  |======================================================================| 100%
L_matrix_poisson <-
  fashr:::fash_L_compute(fash_data_poisson, likelihood = "poisson",
                         num_cores = 1, grid = grid, num_basis = 30,
                         betaprec = 1e-6, order = 2, verbose = TRUE)
#> 
  |                                                                            
  |                                                                      |   0%
  |                                                                            
  |==================                                                    |  25%
  |                                                                            
  |===================================                                   |  50%
  |                                                                            
  |====================================================                  |  75%
  |                                                                            
  |======================================================================| 100%
